name: WASP-142
scenarioDescription:
The WASP-142 Exoplanetary System


Overview

WASP-142 is a star with 1.33 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.64 times its radius. It is located 2739.71 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 2 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

WASP-142 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the WASP-142 system


WASP-142 b

WASP-142 b was discovered by the SuperWASP-South observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of WASP-142 b is 267.12 times the mass of Earth. The radius of WASP-142 b is 17.15 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, WASP-142 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system WASP-142, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by SuperWASP-South.
